subject: mathematics
question_text: A school bought 120 notebooks for the new term. On the first day, they sold 30% of the notebooks. The next day they sold one‑fourth of the remaining notebooks. The rest were packed into boxes that each hold exactly 6 notebooks. How many notebooks are left unpacked after all the full boxes have been filled?
explanation:
First day sales: 30% of 120 = 0.30 × 120 = 36 notebooks.
Remaining after day 1: 120 – 36 = 84 notebooks.
Second day sales: one‑fourth of 84 = 84 ÷ 4 = 21 notebooks.
Remaining after day 2: 84 – 21 = 63 notebooks.
These are packed into boxes of 6. Number of full boxes = 63 ÷ 6 = 10 remainder 3.
So after filling all possible full boxes, 3 notebooks are left unpacked.
